title: 2 new On-Hit items
body:
[](https://i.imgur.com/2jug7Pf.png)

>https://i.imgur.com/yEgU85V.png Intoxicated Arrowhead (Starter Item)
Cost: 450g

>+10 Attack Damage
+5% Attack Speed

>UNIQUE Passive - Toxin: Basic attacks apply a Damage over Time effect lasting 6 seconds (-0.30 per 10% Bonus Attack Speed), dealing 5 (+5 per 10% Bonus Attack Speed) [Adaptive] damage over the full duration.

>***

>https://i.imgur.com/6Qi9Js7.png Intoxicated Bow (Finished Item)
Cost: 3000g

>+30 Attack Damage
+30 Attack Speed

>UNIQUE - Passive: 25% Armor Penetration
UNIQUE Passive - Toxin: Basic attacks apply a Damage over Time effect lasting 6 seconds (-0.90 per 10% Bonus Attack Speed), dealing 10 (+10 per 10% Bonus Attack Speed) [Adaptive] damage over the full duration.

>{{item:3035}} (1300g) + https://i.imgur.com/yEgU85V.png (450g) + {{item:1043}} (1000g) + 250g

###EDIT: For those who are wondering, I only changed the colors of existing items only as a way to represent them of what they would look like in similarity. These items would not act as replacements.

I like it, but the numbers seem a bit high to me.

Starting with the fact that if you have at least 70% bonus attack speed, the DoT becomes flat damage on hit.  

Also, take a simple 3 items plus boots midgame build.  {{item:3006}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3124}} + this item
That's 10 base + 35 boots + 25 botrk + 25-73 rageblade + 30 this item = **125-173 damage on hit.**  That's a lot of extra damage per auto, especially because it will be applied twice every other auto at full rageblade stax.

Then there's runes: Lethal Tempo or Hail of Blades alone would break this item.  Then there's up to 20% from choosing precision, then another 18% from legends: alacrity.  

Not mentioning the fact that champions can have their own attack speed bonuses.  Ashe gets 20-40% from Q, Kog gets 15-35% passive from Q, Kai'sa gets 40-80% from E, Tristana gets 50-110% from Q.  

Let's quickly redo the 3 item build to factor in a Kog'Maw with Lethal Tempo.  Assuming full rageblade stax that's: 10 base + 35 boots + 25 botrk+ 73 rageblade + 30 this item + 35 q passive + 20 precision + 18 legends: alacrity + 110 lethal = **356 bonus damage** on hit from this item alone.

Long story short, it is an interesting item, and I really like that it has a starter item version, but I think that it would be built on only a few champions because it would have to be broken on those champions to be viable for anyone else (**Kog**, Kai'sa, Ashe, etc.)

>I like it, but the numbers seem a bit high to me.

>Starting with the fact that if you have at least 70% bonus attack speed, the DoT becomes flat damage on hit.

>Also, take a simple 3 items plus boots midgame build {{item:3006}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3124}} + this item
That's 10 base + 35 boots + 25 botrk + 25-73 rageblade + 30 this item = 125-173 damage on hit. That's a lot of extra damage per auto, especially because it will be applied twice every other auto at full rageblade stax.

That's a fair point, but ideally it would be best to completely rework Rageblade to be a different kind of On-Hit item, since it's the sole reason why...

* On-Hit champions can't get a new set of On-Hit items
* Why most On-Hit items suck
* Why there's such a lack of On-Hit items to start with

Rageblade alone creates all of the problems above. If it didn't exist or existed in a different form, it would open A LOT more options for what to do regarding that playstyle.

As for the scalling, it doesn't have to be exactly the way I described, it can always be changed. It's nothing but a mere rough example really.

>Long story short, it is an interesting item, and I really like that it has a starter item version, but I think that it would be built on only a few champions because it would have to be broken on those champions to be viable for anyone else (Kog, Kai'sa, Ashe, etc.)

I'm glad you like it, yeah it would definitely need changes because it could be abused on some champions (Twitch/Ashe/Kai'Sa with Intoxicated Arrowhead). It would also require adjusting regarding the interaction with bonuses outside the item category, ideally it would be for the best if the Rune had 0 interaction from Rune bonuses for balance purposes.
